00019 class BILU0Pre : public PreconditionerBase {
00020  public:
00021   BILU0Pre();
00022   virtual ~BILU0Pre();
00023 
00024         // --- setup the preconditioner ---
00025   virtual bool setupFromA(const CompRow_Mat_pointer &matA_);
00026 
00027         // --- solve the system ---
00028   virtual MV_Vector_double solve(const MV_Vector_double& b);
00029   
00030   
00031  private:
00032         int nA;                 // The row dimension of the matrix A. The matrix 
00033         int nElems;
00034 //      int key;        // the size of basic block (nComps in simualtion)
00035 
00036         double *X;
00037 
00038         double **alu;   // matrix stored in Modified Sparse Row (MSR) format containing
00039         int *jlu;               // the L and U factors together. The diagonal (stored in
00040                                         // alu(1:n) ) is inverted. Each i-th row of the alu,jlu matrix
00041                                         // contains the i-th row of L (excluding the diagonal entry=1)
00042                                         // followed by the i-th row of U.
00043                                         //               These two express ONE MATRIX
00044 
00045         int *ju;                // integer array of length n containing the pointers to the beginning
00046                                         //of each row of U in the matrix alu,jlu.
00047 
00048 
00049         int *w;                 // integer work array of length n.
00050 
00051         int ierr;               // integer. Error message with the following meaning.
00052                                         // ierr  = 0    --> successful return.
00053                                         // ierr .gt. 0  --> zero pivot encountered at step number ierr.
00054                                         // ierr  = -1   --> Error. input matrix may be wrong.
00055                                         //                  (The elimination process has generated a
00056                                         //                  row in L or U whose length is .gt.  n.)
00057                                         // ierr  = -2   --> The matrix L overflows the array al.
00058                                         // ierr  = -3   --> The matrix U overflows the array alu.
00059                                         // ierr  = -4   --> Illegal value for lfil.
00060                                         // ierr  = -5   --> zero row encountered.   
00061 
00062         const CompRow_Mat_pointer *matA_ptr;
00063 };
